info.name: Film Manager - Client 1
info.description: REST APIs for the interaction with the Film Manager service.

variable.description: (Required) ID of the film to retrieve

request.description: The private film with ID filmId is retrieved. This operation can be performed on the film if the user who performs the operation is the film's owner.

request.description: The private film with ID filmId is updated. This operation does not allow changing its visibility. This operation can be performed only by the owner.

item.name: Retrieve a review that has been issued/completed for a film

variable.description: (Required) ID of the film whose reviews must be retrieved
(Required) ID of the user to whom the review has been issued

request.description: The review of the film with ID filmID issued to the user with ID reviewerId is retrieved. This operation does not require authentication.

variable.description: (Required) ID of the film whose review must be completed
(Required) ID of the user to whom the review has been issued

request.description: The review of the film with ID filmId and issued to the user with ID reviewerId is completed. This operation only allows setting the "completed" property to the "true" value, and changing the values of the "reviewDate", "rating", and "review" properties. This operation can be performed only by the invited reviewer.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

response.name: Forbidden (the user is not the reviewer)

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

variable.description: (Required) ID of the film whose review invitation must be deleted
(Required) ID of the user to whom the review has been issued

request.description: The review of the film with ID filmId and issued to the user with ID reviewerId is deleted. This operation can only be performed by the owner, and only if the review has not yet been completed by the reviewer.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

response.name: Forbidden (the user is not the owner)

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

response.name: Conflict (the review has already been completed)

Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

item.name: Issue film review to some users

variable.description: (Required) ID of the film

request.description: The film with ID filmId is assigned to one or more users for review and the corresponding reviews are created. The users are specified in the review representations in the request body. This operation can only be performed by the owner.

item.name: Retrieve the list of all the reviews that have been issued/completed for a public film

query.description: ID of the requested page (if absent, the first page is returned)'

variable.description: (Required) ID of the film whose reviews must be retrieved

request.description: All the reviews that have been issued/completed for the public film with ID filmId are retrieved. A pagination mechanism is used to limit the size of messages. This operation does not require authentication.

query.description: ID of the requested page (if absent, the first page is returned)'
ID of the requested page (if absent, the first page is returned)'
ID of the requested page (if absent, the first page is returned)'

item.name: Retrieve an image associated to a public film

variable.description: (Required) ID of the film
(Required) ID of the image

request.description: The image with ID imageId, associated to the film with ID filmId, is retrieved. In particular, by specifying the desired content type via the Accept header, the user can decide whether to retrieve the image data structure (json content type), which does not contain the image file, or the image file itself, in one of the supported image content types (image/png, image/jpg, and image/gif). Only the film owner or a film reviewer can perform this operation.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

item.name: Delete an image associated to a public film

variable.description: (Required) ID of the film
(Required) ID of the image

request.description: The image to be deleted is the one with ID imageId, associated to the film with ID filmId. Only the film owner can delete the image.

item.name: Associate a new image to a public film

request.description: The image sent in request body is associated to the public film characterized by the ID specified in the path. Only the film owner can associate an image to the film.

item.name: Retrieve the list of all the images that have been associated to a public film

variable.description: (Required) ID of the film whose images must be retrieved

request.description: All the images that been associated to the public film with ID filmId are retrieved as a json-encoded array of image data structures. Only the film owner or a film reviewer can retrieve the images.

variable.description: (Required) ID of the film to retrieve

request.description: The public film with ID filmId is retrieved. This operation does not require authentication.

item.name: Assign automatically review invitations for the unassigned public films owned by the authenticated user in a balanced manner

request.description: The films owned by the authenticated user who performed the request and that are not assigned to any user for review, are automatically assigned to the users of the service in a balanced manner. The assignments are returned. Only authenticated users can make this request.

query.description: The id of the requested page (if absent, the first page is returned)

request.description: The public films (i.e., the films that are visible for all the users of the service) are retrieved. This operation does not require authentication. A pagination mechanism is used to limit the size of messages.

query.description: The id of the requested page (if absent, the first page is returned)

request.description: A new film is created by the authenticated user (who becomes the owner).

request.description: The available information (password excluded) about the user specified by userId is retrieved. This operation requires authentication.

item.name: Logs a user in or out

request.description: The user who wants to log in or out sends the user data to the authenticator which performs the operation. For logout, the operation is possible only for authenticated users.
The available information (passwords excluded) about all the users is retrieved. This operation is available only to authenticated users.
